SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

infodynamics.measures.discrete
Interface SingleAgentMeasure

All Known Implementing Classes:
BlockEntropyCalculator, EntropyCalculator, EntropyRateCalculator, SingleAgentMeasureInContextOfPastCalculator
public interface SingleAgentMeasure

Interface to define adding observations and calculating local and average values of info theoretic measures for single agent metrics (e.g. entropy, active information). Would ideally be an abstract class to be inherited from, but it's more important for us to have inheritance from ContextOfPastCalculator, and since java doesn't allow multiple inheritance, one of them has to miss out.

Author:
Joseph Lizier

Method Detail

addObservations

void addObservations(int[][] states)
Add observations in to our estimates of the pdfs. This call suitable only for homogeneous agents, as all agents will contribute to single pdfs.

Parameters:
states - 1st index is time, 2nd index is agent number

addObservations

void addObservations(int[][] states,
                     int col)
Add observations for a single agent of the multi-agent system to our estimates of the pdfs. This call should be made as opposed to addObservations(int states[][]) for computing active info for heterogeneous agents.

Parameters:
states - 1st index is time, 2nd index is agent number
col - index of agent

addObservations

void addObservations(int[][][] states)
Add observations in to our estimates of the pdfs. This call suitable only for homogeneous agents, as all agents will contribute to single pdfs.

Parameters:
states - 1st index is time, 2nd and 3rd index are agent number

addObservations

void addObservations(int[][][] states,
                     int index1,
                     int index2)
Add observations for a single agent of the multi-agent system to our estimates of the pdfs. This call should be made as opposed to addObservations(int states[][]) for computing active info for heterogeneous agents.

Parameters:
states - 1st index is time, 2nd and 3rd index are agent number
index1 - first index of agent
index2 - index of agent in 2nd dimension

computeAverageLocalOfObservations

double computeAverageLocalOfObservations()
Returns the average information theoretic measure from the observed values which have been passed in previously. Must set average, min and max

Returns:

computeLocalAtAgent

double[] computeLocalAtAgent(int[][] states,
                             int col)
Standalone routine to compute local information theoretic measure for one agent in a 2D spatiotemporal array of the states of agents Return a 2D spatiotemporal array of local values. First history rows are zeros This method should be used for heterogeneous agents

Parameters:
states - 1st index is time, 2nd index is agent number
col - - column number of the agent in the states array
Returns:

computeAverageLocalAtAgent

double computeAverageLocalAtAgent(int[][] states,
                                  int col)
Standalone routine to compute average local information theoretic measure for a single agent Returns the average This method suitable for heterogeneous agents

Parameters:
blocksize - - Size of blocks to compute entropy over
base - - base of the states
states - 1st index is time, 2nd index is agent number
col - - column number of the agent in the states array
Returns:
